title: (x) Dutch football shirt name and No. - AG Grotesk Cd {Marc O}
content:
I know this one can be a certain challenge for you guys, however im not doubting on your Type-face knowledge. Can someone please identify the font used in the name as well as in the number. Im begginig to thing the number is Custom made but please try finding it. Thanks Joseph.   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105062654im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/39451.jpg)

 [‹ (x) MoMA Queens - (similar to) Office {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105062654/http:/www.typophile.com/node/5421 "Go to previous forum topic") [Don't know... similar to Didot? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105062654/http:/www.typophile.com/node/5420 "Go to next forum topic")
author: josefinito

comments.content: It's definitively a custom typeface made for Nike.
I dunno Eduardo -- this looks like a squooshed version of Akzidenz Grotesk Light Condensed.
Thanks Mark. I Got Akzidenz Grotesk BE from Adobe Font Folio. Any chance you can figure out if the numbers are part of a font?
Mark it is indeed Akzidenz. Please help me id the numbers.
Joseph, do you have any other samples? The 1 and 0 aren't much to go on.

I'm not sure a single font is being used for all of the numbers. The 6,9 and 2 look like they might be from a geometric like DIN (an older, rougher version -- not FF Din). The 7 doesn't seem to belong with the others.
